CatDescriptText: Miss Mahala Anderson, 3461 Milwaukee Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 30, 1957, pg. 3 with question: "Does the financial aid, given young married couples by parents, encourage or dissuade the latter's realization of marital responsibilities?" answer reads: "I think that it hinders. Young married couples should make it on their own because it will help them in the future."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mahala Anderson, wearing patterned head scarf, light colored ribbed coat, and holding dark gloves and paper shopping bag, one on left with display of lamps, and one on right with display of jewelry
